fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Whenever a user has permissions on a space and that user is deleted from the instance, the space permissions remain and need to be removed manually.

h3. Suggested Solution

Automatically remove any space permissions for users that are deleted
 
h3. Workaround 

Manually remove those space permissions from each space after deleting the user
fields.summary: Remove space permissions for any users accounts that have been deleted

fields.description:

User names should be rendered
h3. Actual Results
User -#### are displayed

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:

fields.summary: User-##### are displayed instead of usernames

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Re-ordering a page hangs when the the space homepage is restricted to a group with a different case setup than the users group membership. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group in lower case. ie. *it-team*
 # Create a space and restrict the home page to *it-team*
 # Add the user as a space admin and to *it-team*
 # Verify that re-ordering a page works via the Space settings.
 # Delete the group *it-team* and create a new group in uppercase *IT-TEAM*
 # Add the user to the group *IT-TEAM*
 # As the user, check that the space can be viewed and try to re-order via the space settings. 

h3. Expected Results

The user is able to access the homepage and the page tree loads on the sidebar menu. The user should also be able to re-order via the space settings. 

h3. Actual Results

The user is able to access the homepage and the page tree loads on the sidebar menu. The page tree does not load when re-ordering via the space settings. 

 !hang.png|thumbnail! 

Console Error :
{code}
confluence.web.resources:page-ordering-tree.js?externals=__local-default__:26 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'position' of undefined
    at Object.success (confluence.web.resources:page-ordering-tree.js?externals=__local-default__:26)
    at d (VM1182 jquery-min.js:1)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (VM1182 jquery-min.js:1)
    at s (VM1182 jquery-min.js:1)
    at XMLHttpRequest.f (VM1182 jquery-min.js:1)
{code}


h3. Workaround

Configure the restricted page to grant access to the uppercase group name.
fields.summary: Re-order pages hangs due to group name casing

fields.description:

* This could also apply to the table view of Jira filters.
fields.summary: Collaboration areas

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, if a user is editing a page, and other user moves the same to a different space, when the same tries to publish the draft, the following error will be displayed:

{quote}
There was an error processing the request.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a user editing a page in space 1.
# Have the page published and then, edit again.
# Have a different user moving this page while the first user is editing it.
# Have the user publishing the page

h3. Expected Results
A proper error message should be displayed, mentioning that the page has been moved.

h3. Actual Results
A message that *There was an error processing the request.* will be displayed.

h3. Notes

* On the console, the following message will be displayed:
{code}
Generic error: {"readyState":4,"responseText":"{\"statusCode\":400,\"data\":{\"authorized\":true,\"valid\":false,\"errors\":[{\"message\":{\"key\":\"You can't change an existing page's space.\",\"args\":[]}}],\"successful\":false},\"message\":\"com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: Could not update Content of type : page with id XXXXXXX\"}","status":400,"statusText":"error"}
{code}
* If the user has a link to the draft of the last editing (still containing the older space key URL), editing this draft will give the same error message.

h3. Workaround

Make sure to access the published mode of the page by tapping its title on the breadcrumbs, or, tap *Close* to save the draft and then, edit it again.
fields.summary: Publishing a draft from a moved page gives a generic error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using ` to create code blocks in Fabric Editor (Confluence only), the block erases the first letter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence file using the new editor experience;
 # Type ` <put some information here> ` and press enter.

h3. Expected Results

All the text will be surrounded by the code block.

h3. Actual Results

The first letter will be erased, one quote will be placed outside the code block while the last one will be included in the code block.

h3. Notes

The video reproducing the behavior: [^Screen+Recording+2019-08-05+at+06.24+PM.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Use the Code Snippet and paste your code inside it.
!Image 2019-08-05 at 6.37.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using ` to create code blocks is erasing the first letter in Fabric Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When your instance is set to allow anonymous users, and it is also correctly set on the space you wish to set up wit public access if there is a calendar added on a page, it will be not visible to anonymous visitors.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a space set with anonymous viewing permissions, as well as the *can use* permission on Global Permissions;
# On any page of this public space, add a non-restricted calendar;
# Publish the page;
# Access the page as an anonymous user.

h3. Expected Results
You are able to see the calendar.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of the calendar, you see: {{Error rendering macro 'calendar' : null}}

h3. Notes
* In the browser's console, it is possible to see a 401 error:
{code}Error loading properties API:  
Object { status: 401, statusText: "Unauthorized", responseText: "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" standalone=\"yes\"?><status><status-code>401</status-code><message>Client must be authenticated to access this resource.</message></status>", getResponseHeader: getResponseHeader(), getAllResponseHeaders: getAllResponseHeaders() }{code}

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to supersede a deleted page with a new page so that all links to the old page will automatically be updated to the new page. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to supersede a page with a new. 

h3. Use Case 

# Create Page 1
# Create Page 2, Page 3, Page 4 – all link to Page 1
# Page 1 is done with the wrong template – and since there is no way to update templates right now after the fact – so user created a new page, Page 5.

The user would like rename Page 5 to Page 1 and make sure that all pages (Page 2-Page 4) as a consequence link to the content in Page 5 (now renamed to Page 1).
fields.summary: Superseding a page with a new

fields.description:
When I create an Anchor Link, it would be most beneficial to be able to select anchors to link them to other pages, as opposed to hand-coding the link + page title. Right now, the way anchor links work, when a page is renamed the anchor link breaks. The mechanism should work similarly to searching for (and linking to) a page so that when a page is renamed or an anchor is renamed, it will automatically link to all pages using that anchor.

One idea is to reuse the Inser Link > Search function so it works for anchors.
 * On the Insert Link modal, add a new section called "Anchors"
 * Reuse Insert Link > Search functionality to allow people to find the correct page.
 * On the bottom of modal, change the "Link Location" breadcrumbs to "Page Selected"
 * Add a dropdown that dynamically populates all anchors on the selected page.
 * Keep "Link text"

This way, people can select the correct anchors without copying/pasting them and (especially) trying to figure out how to use anchors on other pages.

 

Thanks!

!image-2019-08-03-16-39-04-733.png!
fields.summary: Improve Anchor Links macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* When Jira Report Template is created, it does populate the Jira issues from one particular project but the problem comes when there are any updates in the Jira project (like, adding extra issues or changing the status of issues), the updates are not reflected on the respective Confluence Page(which was created using Jira Report Template) 
h3. Environment

Confluence (TinyMCE and Fabric both)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Page A using Jira Report Template(-> changelogs) and select Jira project B while creating the Page.
 # Now, update Jira Project B by adding 2 more issues and changing the status of the issues from ‘in progress’ to ‘done’.
 # Ideally, this change should also reflect on Page A, but it does not.

h3. Expected Results

Changes in *JIRA project B* do not reflect in *Page A*.
h3. Actual Results

Changes in *JIRA project B* should be reflected in *Page A*.
h3. Notes

For ex:
 Page A is created using Jira Report Template(-> changelogs) and a Jira project B is selected while creating the Page. 
 Let, Jira Project B had 2 issues with status ‘in progress’. And this is reflected in Page A when was created.
 Now, we update Jira Project B by adding 2 more issues and changing the status of the issues from ‘in progress’ to ‘done’.
 Ideally, this change should also reflect on Page A, but it does not.

Also, there is one more bug for the Jira Report(only in Fabric editor- *Jira report change log template isn't replacing the placeholder texts* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65378)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA Report template is not working properly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not possible to add inline comment to a single character when the page contains an Expand macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence page, using the legacy editor, add an expand macro and some words
# Publish the page
# Highlight one character in the page
# Click the *Comment* option
# Add a comment, then, hit *Save*


h3. Expected Results
You are able to publish the comment.

h3. Actual Results
The comment won't save and a warning message will be displayed with the following:

{quote}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{quote}


h3. Workarounds
* Highlight more than 1 character.
* Remove the Expand macro from the page
fields.summary: Not possible to add inline comment to a single character when the page contains an Expand macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, specific macros allow the user to link to specific parts of the page, or, a different one (e.g. a link to the [Anchors macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html#InsertLinksandAnchors-Linktoananchor.1], or, the [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294]. When tapping the links created by the Table of Contents macro, or, a link pointing to an anchor, if the page has the percent character (%), the page will break with a "URI malformed" message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and make sure to put the percent character on its title (For example, "Test %").
 # On the page, make sure to add some headers and the Table of Contents macro (so it will create the links to the headers). For the anchor macro, manually create a link pointing to the anchor on the page (or a different one using the percent character).
 # Click on the generated links in order to access a specific part of the page (or a different one for the anchor's scenario)

h3. Expected Results

The link should redirect the user to the correct header on the mentioned page, or a different one.
h3. Actual Results

The following message will be displayed:
{code:java}
Something's gone wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.

Frontend Version: candidate-1160

Error details:
Error: URI malformed.
Error info: 
    in Connect(ViewPageGraphQL)
    in t
    in div
    in t
    in SpaceRestrictionCheck
    in t
    in div
    in Unknown
    in WithStyles()
    in Connect(WithStyles())
    in t
    in div
    in div
    in n
    in t
    in div
    in AtlaskitThemeProvider__LegacyReset
    in t
{code}
h3. Notes
 * This seems to happen because of the page URL not adding the % character. If the user manually accesses the page, it will be visible that this character is not displayed on the browser navigation.
 * If an anchor points to the same page or a different one, this error will be triggered.
 * Normal links pointing to the page will not trigger the issue.

h3. Workaround

Remove the "%" from the page title, or, if pointing to a different page, instead of using the anchors, you can create a link to the page URL only.
fields.summary: Pages with the % character break when clicking from specific macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a search result that returns a single issue (such as "key = EXAMPLE-1") if you set the display to be a table type and specify custom fields to be displayed. After you save and publish the page, editing the macro search (e.g. "key = EXAMPLE-2") and insert the macro, the changes to the macro will not be saved. 

Alternatively, setting the macro to display "single issue" also does not allow the search to be changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # on a page, insert a Jira issue macro
 # In the macro, set the search such that only one issue is returned. Then in the display settings, specify "table" as the display mode, and cut out a few of the fields to "customize" the fields that are displayed.
 # insert the macro, and then publish the page.
 # edit the page again, then edit the macro and change the search in the macro to point to another issue.
 # insert the macro.

h3. Expected Results

The changes to the macro search are reflected.

h3. Actual Results

The change is not persisted.

h3. Notes

- This issue seems to impact the macro if single issue is selected.
- This issue seems to not be triggered if you create the macro with a search that finds multiple issues then reduce the scope of the search to a single issue.

h3. Workaround

- Remove the macro and recreate it from scratch.
- Create the macro with a search that returns multiple issues first, then save it, finish by paring down the search to find only one issue. For example using the "key in ()" clause instead of "key =" clause in the JQL search.
fields.summary: Edits to Jira Issue macro do not save if search returns a single issue

fields.description:
Can we have a centralised stylesheet and title page/header/footer control point? So instead of making a style sheet for each space, we can make a single one and apply it to multiple spaces. Or we might have a set of stylesheets and can select the one we want to use. 

Ditto title pages etc. If we can view them all together, and edit or clone them centrally, creating new similar but slightly different ones for PDF export would be much quicker. This would have saved me a lot of time today. And a lot of copy and pasting...
fields.summary: Better handling of Look and Feel PDF export features

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create/Edit Template page formatting is broken.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any space in the instance.
 # go to Space settings > Content Tools > Templates
 # click on ‘Create New Template’ or try to edit an existing template

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to create/edit templates without any formatting issues.
h3. Actual Results

Notice that the template title is in the middle of the page instead of at the top.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-01 at 10.41.55 am.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Open the template editor
 # Once you see the broken editor, press F12 (assuming you are using Firefox or Chrome). This will open your browser's inspector
 # In the inspector, use the search to find the .editor-fullheight class in the code
 # Look for the properties in the HTML named "width" and "height" which will be in % and change them to values similar to: width=1200px and height=4000px
 # This will not make it look properly but at least will allow you to work on it.
fields.summary: Create/Edit Template page formatting is broken

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using the Confluence Cloud app for mobile devices, it's not possible to sign into more than one Confluence Cloud site. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to switch between Cloud instances on the same device. Ideally, this would work by showing all Cloud instances that are associated with the user's Atlassian ID, and there would also be a way to use an account switcher (in the event that the user has more than one Atlassian ID across their Cloud instances.)

h3. Why this is important
Many of our users use multiple instances of Confluence and each time they'd have to log out and back in if they need to switch instances on their device.

h3. Workaround
It's currently possible to log out and then back in with your Atlassian ID, where you will be met with a list of sites tied to your Atlassian ID. But it appears there is no way to get back to this screen again after you have selected your site, in case you want to switch sites.

 !Screenshot 2019-07-31 at 14.55.14.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to switch between instances on mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With full-width option and with the left and right sidebar layouts, the table doesn't respect the chosen layout. The table will look perfect when in the Editor, however, in when viewing the page the table grows in width forcing a scroll horizontally, even if the table contents are limited and should have no problem fitting the column width.
h3. Environment
 - New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and select to use for instance column layout with right sidebar
 # Add content, including at least one table with text in the sidebar column
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The table will fit inside the limits of the layout column, just as it does in the editor.
h3. Actual Results

The table in the sidebar column increases in width forming a horizontal scroll bar.

h3. Notes

- The table column cannot be resized(dragged), it would need to be the same width for all columns to ensure that the horizontal bar does not show up after published
- Additionally, zooming out will also show the complete table in most cases.

h3. Workaround
The add-on [Advanced Tables for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/197/advanced-tables-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] would be an alternative by using the table plus macro by copy and pasting the current(columns dragged) table in the table plus macro
 !Edit Table plus.png|thumbnail! 
 !View Table plus.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Table width changes when publishing when table in layout column (sidebar)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to create a child page in the selected parent page from the page tree (+ icon)
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1.Go to page tree in space and click on a page title(ex:test image) in the page tree.
 # Step 2.Click on a plus ( + ) icon next to any other page title (ex:page link)
 # Step 3. The first dialog with page template show correct parent page(page link)
 # Step 4.click on create then the newly created page has different parent page(test page)

h3. Expected Results

Parent page should be the same as the selected page(first dialog with page template show correct parent)
h3. Actual Results

It shows a different parent page.
h3. Workaround

Option 1 : Click on the page(select a page) and click on the + icon next to the same page(selected page) then it creates a child page within the selected page.

Option 2 : On the _Create_ form, try the new editing experience.
fields.summary: Unable to create a child page in the selected parent page from the page tree (+ icon)

fields.description:
This ticket was previously opened a bug, but is actually a feature suggestion.

New editor experience
Template editing: When editing the template directly, a user is not able to edit the placeholder text after the fact. The user would need to delete the placeholder and retype.

This is very inconvenient if long text has been entered and needs to be copied or edited.
fields.summary: Placeholder text on templates created with the new editor cannot be selected nor edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to edit/ add a comment to a Confluence page that has the *Attachments macro*, it will: 
* open the editor, but, will only keep loading with a spinning icon, instead of displaying the content. 
* Open the comment dialog but the user won't be able to type the comment.

This seems to be affecting specific instances and environments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Insert the *Attachments macro* on it.
# Publish the page and access a different page (or, manually reload the page and clear the browser cache)
# Publish the page again and then, try to edit the same or comment on it

h3. Expected Results
* The editor should open, allowing the user to edit the page.
* It should be possible to add comments to the page

h3. Actual Results
* The editor keeps loading
* It's not possible to add comments on view mode

h3. Notes
The following is observed on the console:

{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'openDialog' of undefined
    at t.<computed>.t.<computed>.init (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins~dc51bad7.da91a7f2df430abbc5a1-v38.js:1)
    at EC (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at Array.<anonymous> (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at Object.nn [as each] (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1
    at DC (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at tw.<anonymous> (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at Array.<anonymous> (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at nn (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
    at c (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v38.js:1)
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Refresh the editor and the editor will be loaded.
* Remove the attachment macro from the page.
*OR*
* Manually copy the page to a new one using the *Try the new editing experience* templates, as the issue is not affecting the new editor ;)
fields.summary: Attachments macro on a page causes problems to edit and comment the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a space overview page in the old editing experience when adding a *Children Display* macro as the first content on the page, the published version won't have a blank line between the page title and the body.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 * Old editing experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a space that already has some pages, edit its overview page;
 # Right after the title, insert a *Children Display* macro;
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The published page has a margin between the title and the content.
h3. Actual Results

The page doesn't have a line between the content and the title.

!image-2019-07-30-16-02-50-317.png!
h3. Workaround

Hit *enter* before to insert the *Children Display* macro.
fields.summary: Children Display right after page title

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no way to migrate specific pages to the new editor, to test the new experience's compatibility

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to migrate specific existing pages to the new editor.

h3. Workaround
Copy and paste the content to a new blank page using the new editing experience but this can sometimes cause unexpected results (problems on content and layout of the page)
fields.summary: Provide a way for users to migrate specific pages to the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the new editing experience, when a video file is uploaded, after publishing the page it will only be reproducible in the first time you play it right after publishing the page. If you refresh the page, it turns to be a downloadable file.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New editing experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert a video file (dragging & drop or using the Files & Images, doesn't matter the way);
# Publish the page;
# Reproduce the video;
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results
After refreshing the page, the video should keep being reproducible.

h3. Actual Results
The video is now an only downloadable file.

h3. Notes
* If you edit the page and add another video file, the published page gets all the videos reproducible again - but for a single time.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Uploaded videos play just once

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Application links created with *Jira Server* & *Confluence Cloud* fails to render Jira issues & displays the error "Unable to get data due to an unexpected error". Upon Editing the macro, gives a user the chance to *login & approve*.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Server
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Application links

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy *Jira Server* instance.
 # Make it publicly accessible
 # Connect through *Application link*
 # Create few test tickets on Server
 # Mention them on a Confluence Page.

h3. Expected Results

Regardless of the user roles, it should render even if they are not able to authenticate once.
h3. Actual Results

Presently it renders only for *site-admins* on both instances and validates OAuth authentication.

h3. Notes

The API gives below results {code}{"errors":[{"context":null,"message":"Please authenticate with JIRA to view issue details","exceptionName":"com.atlassian.integration.jira.JiraAuthenticationRequiredException","authenticationUri":"https://changesrandhawa.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=xxxxxxx","applicationName":"Jira JIRA"}]}{code}


h3. Workaround

One can provide *site-admin* access temporarily to the users so that they can authenticate at least once and later revoke their access. This will render the Jira issues permanently for them.
fields.summary: "Jira Issues" fails to render when Jira Server is linked with Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not able to view files in a page when a user clicks on it. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Confluence in Safari or Firefox
 # Upload a pdf file to a page and save it
 # Click on the pdf file

(i) The page freezes up with a spinning circle sometimes. 

h3. Expected Results

The file is displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The file is being downloaded.



h3. Workaround
Use Google Chrome, if possible.
fields.summary: Can't view files in Safari and Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding comments in attachments, no comment resolution is returned (take note of the container):

!f35e4797-4bd7-41fe-97d7-9fbd0bd99e5d.png|width=571,height=526!

 

In comparison to pages:


 !Snip20190729_8.png|width=907,height=501!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add attachment
 # Add comment in attachment
 # Invoke: GET /wiki/rest/api/content/ \{id}/child/comment?expand=extensions.resolution and no resolutions are returned. Comment resolutions are returned however for pages

h3. Expected Results

Comment resolutions are returned
h3. Actual Results

No comment resolutions returned
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: No comment resolution returned on attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the new editing experience, when using the *Create from template* macro, if you set a title on the *Title of page to be created* macro field, the page created from the macro doesn't come with a title.

h3. Environment
* Cloud 
* New editing experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert the *Create from template* macro;
# In the macro settings chose any template;
# On the *Title of page to be created* field, fill it as 'Banana', for example;
# Publish the page;
# On the published page, click over the *Create from template* button.

h3. Expected Results
A new page with the 'Banana' title is created.

h3. Actual Results
A new page with an empty title is created.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Title set on Create From Template macro doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When working with Attachments either via the [Attachments macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html] or the page attachments, the View and Edit buttons are automatically downloading the attachment file, in addition to allowing the user to see/edit it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Scenario 1 :

# Create/edit a page in Confluence
# In this page, make sure to add the [Attachments macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html].
# After publishing the page, if the same does not have any attachment, make sure to upload one. If the page already has an attachment, the same will be displayed on the macro
# Tap the arrow on the left side of the attachment's name/link
# Tap View or Edit.


Scenario 2 :
# Open the page attachments via the three dot menu
# Click on View or Edit for a given attachment


h3. Expected Results
The attachment would be previewed/displayed, or, be opened in the Companion app in order to be edited.

h3. Actual Results
Besides being previewed/displayed (or edited), the attachment will be downloaded as well.

h3.Notes

In Firefox, after automatically downloading the file, the screen will keep loading and will need to be refreshed in order to properly interact with Confluence again.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tapping View/Edit on Attachments downloads the file

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the recent update, the ability to show *All People* in People Directory as outlined on this [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/search-the-people-directory-724765425.html] is no longer available

h3. Suggested Solution
Add back the ability to show *All People* in People Directory.
fields.summary: Add back All People option in People Directory

fields.description: On the old editor, we have options to *Move up/Move down* on the *Layouts* feature. This resource is helpful when creating content on Confluence, and it would be great to have it back on the new editing experience! :D
fields.summary: Move up/Move Down Layouts option

The Layouts feature, on the new editing experience, doesn't have an option to add only a section. When adding it, it comes with two sections by default.

This suggestion aims to insert the option to have only a single section on the Layouts feature:

Old editor's Layouts options:
!image-2019-07-29-10-00-17-565.png!

New editor's Layouts options:

fields.summary: Additional option in the Layouts - New Editing Experience

fields.description: Login fails with 'Your operation is taking longer than usual' error
fields.summary: Login fails with 'Your operation is taking longer than usual' error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting a page to word, if the page contains a Profile Picture macro, the picture won't be exported.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert the Profile Picture macro
 # Save the macro and publish the page
 # *•••* -> *Export to Word*

h3. Expected Results

The document should contain the profile picture
h3. Actual Results

The document doesn't contain the profile picture
h3. Notes
 * It happens on both legacy and new editors
 * It doesn't happen on PDF export

h3. Workaround
 * Download the profile picture from the page and re-attach it to the word document

OR
 * Export the document to PDF instead
fields.summary: Profile picture macro is not exported on word export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When taking a screenshot on an OSX, cropping the image in a wider way and saving the file, if you drag this image to the editor, it gains additional margins under and over the file that are not native from the image.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New editing experience
* OSX

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Macbook, take a screenshot with *COMMAND+SHIFT+3*;
# Open the screenshot (located on the right-bottom side of your screen;
# Crop the screenshot in a wider way (horizontal rectangle);
# Save the screenshot (as default, it goes to your desktop);
# Drag and drop the file to the new editing experience.

h3. Expected Results
The image is inserted correctly, without additional margins, just the file with its size.

h3. Actual Results
The file gains additional margins that are not presented in the original file.

h3. Workaround
Use a third-party app to take screenshots, like the *[Lightshot|https://app.prntscr.com/en/download.html]*, which you can take the screenshot, select what you want to contain in your image and use *COMMAND+C* / *COMMAND+V* to add the image on the page.
fields.summary: Drag and drop a wider image from a screenshot file adds a blank margin in the file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Show More* link on Overview Page under the section 'Recently updated articles' does not work.
 It takes the user to a blank Page
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud- Fabric Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Overview page of any Space in Fabric Editor.
 # Click on 'Show More' under section 'Recently updated articles'.

h3. Expected Results

It should load previous activities happened in the Spaces.
h3. Actual Results

A blank page opens.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Show more link on Overview Page does not work
Analytics Permissions - groups are not set according they are on the Site Administration

fields.description:
h3. Current SItuation
Space exports currently export users with their AAID instead of emails. If a customer wants to export users with their emails he/she would have to do a full site backup.

h3. Desired Situation
This is not ideal when doing space exports, instead, admins should be able to choose between exporting spaces with users' emails or AAID.

This could be useful for syncing up an already existing userbase with imported Spaces.
fields.summary: Add user emails to space exports instead of Atlassian Account ID (AAID)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using new Confluence Editor, copying a Page Properties macro and pasting it to another will just past it as plain text. Same when you copy it through Page Source.

h3. Environment
New Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page Properties macro
# Copy the Page Properties macro
# Paste it on another location

h3. Expected Results
* You should be able to copy the Page Properties macro. 

h3. Actual Results
* Using new Confluence Editor, copying a Page Properties macro and pasting it to another will just past it as plain text.
 
h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Unable to create a copy of Page Properties macro

fields.description: Good Morning, I have been tasked with inquiring about a team calendar that would have several functionalities. This calendar would need to be a single view for 200+ employees. The managers' requirements are as follows- A button to create/add request/activity; A new window for filling out a request that goes to the manager/team; manager is then able to open the request and approve or decline based on notes and criteria; once a decision has been saved, the requester is automatically alerted to the results; if approved, the request automatically comes up on the team calendar and is color coded. They would also like the events on the calendar to function as a hyper link where you can click the name/date and the calendar shows details like person's backup, when they'll return, etc. Is this something Confluence can do?
fields.summary: Looking for custom team calendar set up

fields.description: It would be very useful if there is a Plug in to restrict the mentions per space, that is mention only users who have access to the respective space.
fields.summary: Restrict Mentions per Space

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you restore pages in Confluence, it will be restored to the root of the space, not to its old location. This means that it sits at the same level in the page tree as your home page, so it won't be visible to anyone from the space sidebar.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to restore deleted pages to its old location.
fields.summary: Restore deleted pages to its old location

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When copying external contents (such as google docs), if a text containing images is selected and copied to Confluence, the text will be copied but not the images.

h3. Environment
* New editing experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a document on Google Drive with text and images
# Copy all the text (including the images)
# Create a new page on Confluence and paste the content

h3. Expected Results
The content should be inserted on the page

h3. Actual Results
Only the text is inserted
|  !copy_contents_crop.gif|width=750!  |

h3. Notes
If only the image is selected, it will be successfully inserted on the editor.

h3. Workaround
Manually download the images and upload them to the editor.
fields.summary: Copying content from external sources won't bring images on the new editor

fields.description:
Currently, when we create a space based on the *Documentation* blueprint, it generates two default pages: *Getting Started* and under this one, the *Making a Template* one.

This child page *Making a Template* has some instructions guiding the user to create a space template. The piece that must be updated is right on the first step:
{quote}# Go to "Space Tools" in the sidebar, select "Content Tools" and create a new template.{quote}

Note that "_Space Tools_" doesn't exist anymore. This option is now called *Space Settings*.

Please, help us to get it fixed :)
fields.summary: Update the instructions on the default Documentation Space page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The special character '-' is breaking search/not returning expected results
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The space '3-ce' should be found using words such as '-ce' or '3-c' but typing that in the Spaces Directory does not fetch this

h3. Expected Results

'3-ce' space should be found
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is fetched
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ensure special character '-' returns space results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an image is pasted in the editor while the cursor is in the same line where the text is located, the image is placed below the text and new lines (padding) are added before and after the image, new lines that were not there before the image was pasted.

h3. Environment

New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a page and add some text to a line
# Make sure there is no extra new lines below the text that was added
# Paste an image in the editor (it can be of any size, but smaller images are better to see the issue)

h3. Expected Results
The image is added in the same line as the text
h3. Actual Results

The image is added in a new line below the line of text, and extra padding is added before and after the image.

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Pasting an image in the editor adds extra padding (new lines) before and after the image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User with only JIRA access in the instance, cannot access the Public Confluence Space.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Let be a user A with just JIRA product access and not Confluence.
# User A will login into JIRA.
# Provide the URL of Public Confluence Space of the same instance to the user A.
# Without logging out of the Confluence, when User A accesses the Public Confluence Space, the user will not be able to access it.

h3. Expected Results
User must be able to access the Public Space.
h3. Actual Results
User is not able to access the Public Space.
https://instancename.atlassian.net/login?application=confluence&dest-url<...publicspace...>&permission-violation=true

h3. Workaround
Access Space in incognito mode or in another browser where the user is not logged in into his/her instance.
fields.summary: User with only JIRA access in the instance, cannot access the Public Confluence Space

fields.description: When users scroll through a page, the left navigation also moves up. It should be sticky and continue to display and only the main content on the page on the right needs to move. A similar request for the global search bar. It disappears on scroll.
fields.summary: Make left navigation sticky

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you try to follow a link to a point inside another page (such as an anchor in the old editor or a heading in the new editor) when you are not currently logged in, you will get to the page but not the link target.
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a link to an anchor or heading in a page
 # Log out (or open an incognito session)
 # Paste the link into a new tab

h3. Expected Results

Expect to navigate to the page, then scroll to the target within the page.
h3. Actual Results

Page is navigated to, but target is not scrolled to.
h3. Notes

The problem is that the part of the URL which starts with a hash (#) is currently cut off during login.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Following a deep link (link to point inside another page) doesn't work if not logged in

fields.description: Currently, Confluence returns deleted pages in the search results. It would be nice if we could have a checkbox right below the search bar for exclude deleted pages from results. This way, it makes an option to include or not deleted pages on our searches, having a better search experience on Confluence.
fields.summary: Remove deleted pages from search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The user gets redirected to the home page even after selecting particular Space while Onboarding Confluence.

h3. Environment
Confluence- Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite the user.
 # Below Page will appear to the user, select any Space.
 # User will be redirected to the home/activity Space instead of the selected Space.
 

h3. Expected Results
User should be redirected to the Page which is selected by the user only.
h3. Actual Results
User is redirected to the home/activity Page.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The user gets redirected to the home/activity page

fields.description: Multiple Knowledge Base could be linked with single Jira Service Desk Project
fields.summary: Link multiple KBs with single JSD project

fields.description:
Currently if you set a new home page for a space, there is a chance that the space tree is disconnected from the home page and results in navigation issues until the situation is corrected in the space settings.

It would be helpful if the user applying the changes were prompted to perform this change immediately and automatically.
fields.summary: Provide dialog box to modify page tree when new space homepage is set

fields.description:
Confluence has the option of hyperlinks but manually have to upload files from Windows machine. However, it's quite time-consuming to upload then and hence looking for a way to insert a link or path to local files. There should be a macro that allows users to browse through the files and insert them as the path/link to those files. For example, file://path_to_my_file/myfile.txt.
Note: It works in preview mode but after publishing the page it won't be taking it as a link.

Already checked in the kb: https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/cannot-link-to-local-files-from-within-confluence-216958257.html but the workaround provided is not a feasible option.
fields.summary: Link to local files from within Confluence

fields.description:
Currently Confluence Cloud offers no way to hide referrer info to linked external sites.

Adding a way to enable this would be beneficial to the overall Cloud experience.
fields.summary: Add feature to  hide referrer info to linked external sites

fields.description: Would be useful, if there is a way to customize the default message that appears on a Restricted Page to a user-defined one.
fields.summary: Ability to Customise Default Dialog on a Restricted Page

fields.description:
Currently the Web View and Mobile iOS Apps for Confluence Cloud do not render a number of macros.

This results in a suboptimal mobile experience. Rendering these would make the overall experience better.
fields.summary: Improve Macro Rendering in iOS App and Mobile View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, spaces in Confluence are created with the following options:
* Overview
* Blog

Example: 
 !CleanShot 2020-04-28 at 15.15.23.png|thumbnail! 

It's possible to toggle them on or off on a space-by-space basis, but you can't change the name of the link (e.g. _Blog_ to _News_ or _Overview_ to _Home_), and it's also not possible to toggle a global space default (i.e. to disable Blog link for all new spaces in the future, the way we can set a default set of global Space Permissions)

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be very useful if there is an option to change or customize the default space sidebar menus.

Example:
* Ability to modify the text of the links
* Ability to set a global default for space sidebar settings for all new spaces.
* Set a group of default space shortcuts to use.
 
h3. Workaround 
* In order to disable Overview and Space menus on a +single+ space, as a space admin, navigate to *Space Settings* > *Sidebar Configuration*. Under _Choose what appears in your sidebar_, toggle the menu options you want to hide:
 !CleanShot 2020-04-28 at 15.16.15.png|thumbnail! 
* Note there is no workaround to modify the text of the menu options, but you can change where the Overview page links by [setting a new page as the Overview|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-your-space-homepage/].

{quote}# Click on the _space name_ in the navigation, and click *Space Settings* to open the *Overview* tab.
# Choose *Edit Space Details*.
# Enter the page you want use in the *Home page* field then choose _Save_.{quote}
fields.summary: Allow Customisation on Confluence Sidebar Menus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Old editor hangs completely OR it takes a lot of time to load if there are 10+ columns and unclose them using markdown syntax.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page with Old Editor where there will be 10+ columns and have the last column not "closed"
 ie.
{code:java}
| test | test| test| test| test| test| test| test| test| test| test| test| test{code}

 # Have your cursor at the end of this line and hit "Enter". This should create a table with columns.

h3. Expected Results

A table with 10+ columns is created, last "test" word is not a part of the table.
h3. Actual Results

Page freezes on Chrome and Firefox, while the new line delays for brief seconds on Safari
h3. Workaround

Closing the table by adding "|" at the end, will make the page work correctly
fields.summary: Including 10+ columns into a page without closing it will hang the page on Firefox and Chrome

fields.description:
Confluence does not have an option of creating custom space blueprints. Currently, you can only enable/disable the standard blueprints (Software project space, Knowledge base, Team space, Documentation space).

Please provide an option to create custom space blueprints.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of customised space blueprints

fields.description:
Creating this ticket in Confluence Cloud project (based on the original request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-4997)

 

*Original request description:*
 We requested this plugin to be made available under AOD-19887 only to find that a new policy has been implemented that prevents this. We are therefore requesting this as a bundled plugin.
fields.summary: Request for Sharepoint plugin to be bundled with Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you are editing a page and another user adds an inline comment the published version of the page you are editing, Confluence generates a new version of the page.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Old Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an already published page, edit it;
# Log in your instance with a different user on a private window;
# Access the published page you are editing with your main user;
# Add an inline comment on it;
# Go back to your main account and close the editing mode;
# Go to the page history.

h3. Expected Results
No new version of the page is created.

h3. Actual Results
A new version of the page is created.

h3. Notes
* The new version has the *Changed By* field filled with your both users;
* If you compare the new version with the previous one, there is no difference between them.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page in editing mode gains a new version if an inline comment is added on its published version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you export a page to PDF, the headings in the PDF file doesn't match to the ones in the page in size, font and type.
h3. Environment

New editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add some different headings
# Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The headings size, font and type in the PDF export match the ones in the page.

h3. Actual Results

The headings in the PDF don't match the ones in the page.

 !Screen Shot 2019-07-22 at 14.24.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Export to PDF doesn't respect heading size, font and type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The table containing the team members in a Team Space overview page is wider than the rest of the page after the page is created and edited for the first time, and clicking the "Back to center" button widens the contents even further, making it scrollable beyound the cell contents.
h3. Environment
New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team space and add more than 2 members
# Once the space is created you're redirected to the space overview
# Edit the overview page and modify and aspect of the page

h3. Expected Results
The table containing the team members match the page layout

h3. Actual Results
The table is wider than the contents, and clicking the "Back to center"/"Go wide" buttons multiple times makes the cells very wide, much wider than the cell contents.

 !Screen Shot 2019-07-22 at 13.28.22.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: The table containing the team members in a Team Space overview page is wider than the rest of the page

fields.description:
Hi,

 

is it possible for you to make the edit (e), Save for later (f), watch (w) and share buttons load at the same time?

Our user constantly face the problem, that the want to edit a page, which isn't fully loaded yet.

They want to click on the Edit button, but before they manage to click it the share button loads in and the exidently click on something else.

Due to that it would be great if all those buttons would load in at the same time to get rid of this issue.

 

Thanks and regards

Maximilian
fields.summary: Irritating load times for buttons

fields.description: Provide an option for the user to choose start/end time for all-day events in the team calendar. The user should be able to choose start/end time for the Jira all-day event or move all-day event for the specific time on the event day.
fields.summary: Event start and end times in team Calendar
Ability to have custom macro editor dialog without chrome

fields.description:
*Summary*

Able to implement automatic backups of Spaces from Confluence to Google Drive, with the following behavior:

* If a new space is created \(for example Project_0001\) in Confluence: a directory will be created in a specified path of Google Drive \(for example root_of_drive / Documentation / Project_0001\).

*  If a page is created as a directory of other pages \(see screenshot\): a subdirectory will be created in Google Drive according to its location in the Confluence Space \(see screenshot, for example a subdirectory 'Reports' inside the main directory of the space, it must allow nesting\).

*  If a page is created in Confluence where info is added on, for example, a Report \(see capture report1\) or a page with general information \(see capture Test Page\), a file \(PDF\?, Word\?\) Will be created in the directory where the page is located.

*  We have currently modified through the tools that Confluence provides us the way in which they are exported to PDF pages of a Space, we would like to:

*  When creating a page, it is automatically exported to PDF and saved in Google Drive according to its location in the Confluence Space.

*  When updating a page, it is automatically exported to PDF and saved as a new PDF file, keeping the original \(control version of the file\).

\- As is logical, if the structure of the Space is modified it must be replicated in Google Drive \(change directory name, delete directory ... etc\), it must also be replicated to delete pages.
fields.summary: Backups of Confluence Spaces to Google Drive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you have a numbered list, it is not possible to add some macros in the middle of the numbered list. The macros are placed into the next line after the list is ended.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a numbered list into a page;
# Add a macro in the middle of the list (the Activity Stream macro, for example)

h3. Expected Results
The macro is placed in the number you inserted in the list.

h3. Actual Results
The macro is inserted in the line after the numbered list is ended.

h3. Notes
It seems to happen with macros that don't involve text directly in the page, like the Status macro, or Code Snippet macro.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not possible to add some macros into a numbered list

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to move an entire table within the page. 

The only way to change the place of a table is to select it all, cut it and paste into the line you wish. It would be cooler and faster if we could cust drag and drop it with the mouse cursor.
fields.summary: Move tables within the page

fields.description: As a user, it would be helpful if there was an operation in the Content Tools to copy/clone an existing user-created template rather than have to manually re-create a template substantially similar to one that already exists in Content Tools.
fields.summary: Allow users to clone/copy User Created Templates in Space Settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you have a table 60x20, the editor starts to being slow. 
After 70x20, it starts to stop saving for a moment, then it saves.
Bigger than that, it becomes uneditable and breaks.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Add a table;
# Insert some text in the first three columns that lead the cells to break a line;
# Insert 17 new lines;
# Insert 57 columns.

h3. Expected Results
The editor keeps behaving normally.

h3. Actual Results
At this moment (size at 60x20), the editor starts to become slow. Bigger than that, it eventually stops to save the draft and breaks. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Large tables makes the editor slow and sometimes break it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Per the [Confluence Cloud Roadmap|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-editor-roadmap-967314556.html]

{quote}Indent/outdent and undo/redo
These buttons have been removed, but the functionality still exists and can be accessed using the following keyboard shortcuts.

Indent: Use the tab key

Outdent: Use shift + tab{quote}

However, when in a columned layout, the tab key does not work. It only skips you to the next column.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with the new editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a columned layout in a new page, place your cursor inside of one of the columns, and type the *tab* key. This should indent your text, but instead it moves to the next column.

h3. Expected Results
Text within the layout should be indented when typing the tab key.

h3. Actual Results
Cursor moves to the next column

h3. Workaround
Indent text using the space bar.
fields.summary: Indenting text with tab is not possible in column layout on new editor

fields.description:
Single Column feature in Fabric/New Editor is missing.
  !image-2019-07-19-16-35-39-261.png|thumbnail! 
This feature is available in TinyMC/Old Editor.

This limitation is more apparent when using sections. The current layout options supports *center*, *wide* and *full-width* while the page width only supports *center* and *full width*. When using wide option for the sections, there is no way to align the unsectioned area. 

 !single column.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Missing Single Column in fabric Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images are not being displayed while editing the page with the new editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with images in it or navigate to an existing page with images
 # Hit the edit button

h3. Expected Results
The images should be shown

h3. Actual Results
A grey box is shown instead

h3. Notes
It might take a couple of minutes/ refreshes for the problem to happen. 

 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images attached to page won't be displayed on edit mode

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the user works with links, there are no options to change the same and trying to change the color of it by changing the font's color is not an option [as stated in this previously reported bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-57259].

This is a suggestion to allow hyperlinks to have its colors modified in order to adapt the customer experience in terms of look and feel.
fields.summary: Ability to change hyperlink colors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

cannot add multiple labels in a page (in firefox) from the *label icon.*
 The issue occurs only in Edit mode.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Click on "Add Labels" button
 # Type label name into the box
 # Click "Add"
 Then cannot type another label name in the box (keeps on losing focus)

h3. Expected Results

After adding one label, user cannot type another label name in the box (keeps on losing focus)
h3. Actual Results

User should be able to add multiple labels.
h3. Workaround

Use other browser or add a label in view mode instead of edit mode.
fields.summary: cannot add multiple labels in a page (in FireFox)

fields.description: Currently, if a space is configured as default homepage for the instance, the sidebar doesn't show the list of pages in that space - instead, it only displays the Global NavBar.
fields.summary: Show space's sidebar/page tree as homepage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are two pages, in specific, that have being pointed out as having old Confluence's UI. Those are:
* [https://www.atlassian.com/collaboration/confluence-organize-work-in-spaces]


And

* [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-a-space-from-a-template-827106195.html]

As can be seen in this next screenshot the UI does not reflect Confluence's current one.
 !original screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
And 
 !current UI.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
* Images to be updated with Confluence's current UI
fields.summary: Pages currently displaying outdated UI screenshots.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we try to copy a table from Excel, it won't paste in the Confluence editor. It is only possible to paste it as a plain text.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Both editing experiences

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Excel table and copy it;
# Paste it into the Confluence editor.

h3. Expected Results
The table is pasted successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Notes
If you try the same from a Google Sheet, it works as the expected.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not possible to copy a table from Excel
